steps.name: Plan Your Location
steps.description: Before you officially form & register your business, its important to have a target location and lease in mind - that way you can form & register your business using your proposed business address. If you change the location of your restaurant after you form & register, you will need to file an ammendement to your Business Formation & Registration,

tasks.name: Identify a potential lease
tasks.description: Based on your business, target market and other key factors, identify a potential lease

tasks.name: Verify zoning
tasks.description: Verify that your desired building is zoned for a resturant, and that a commercial kitchen exists or can be built.

tasks.name: Confirm liquor license availability
tasks.description: If you plan on serving liquor, verify the cost and availability of a liquor license in your area.

tasks.name: Inquire about Local Permits Required
tasks.description: Contact the local Dept of Health to understand future permits you will need to file for once you've signed your lease

steps.name: Research and Prepare Your Business License
Sign Your Lease & File Local Permits
steps.description: You can now sign your lease and file local permits under the protection of your new legal entity and business name.

tasks.name: Sign Your Lease
tasks.description: You can now sign your lease under your official business name and corporate structure

tasks.name: Obtain Building Permit
tasks.description: To do any construction and most renovations, you'll need to file for a building permit with your local construction office.

destination.name: Form Available from DCA, submitted to Local Construction Office

tasks.name: Get your floor plan approved by your local DOH
tasks.description: Get your floor plan and kitchen approved by your local DOH. Afterwards you will need to schedule periodic follow-ups.

tasks.name: Complete Food Safety Course
tasks.description: While not all restaurants are required to do so, many restaurants serving raw food and other delicate items must complete a Food Safety training.

tasks.name: Obtain your Liquor License
tasks.description: To obtain a local liquor license, contact your city clerk for availability, and ensure you meet all requirements detailed in the Alcoholic Beverage Control Handbook.
